SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

org.bluez.v3
Interface Adapter

All Superinterfaces:
Adapter, DBusInterface
public interface Adapter
extends Adapter

The "Adapter" interface provides methods to setup the local adapter(s), search remote devices, pairing and search for services.

This interface is considered stable and no change is planned.

For each available adapter the hcid register an adapter object instance provided in the path "/org/bluez/hci{0, 1, 2, ...}". Service org.bluez

Interface org.bluez.Adapter

Object path /org/bluez/{hci0,hci1,...} Created base on D-Bus API description for BlueZ bluez-utils-3.36/hcid/dbus-api.txt

          This signal will be send every time the remote class of device has been changed.

          This signal will be send if a low level connection between two devices has been created.
static class Adapter.RemoteDeviceDisappeared
          This signal will be send when an inquiry session for a periodic discovery finishes and previously found devices are no longer in range or visible.
static class Adapter.RemoteDeviceDisconnected
          This signal will be send if a low level connection between two devices has been terminated.
static class Adapter.RemoteDeviceDisconnectRequested
          This signal will be sent when a low level disconnection to a remote device has been requested.
static class Adapter.RemoteDeviceFound
          This signal will be send every time an inquiry result has been found by the service daemon.

Error.NotReady

GetVersion

java.lang.String GetVersion()
Returns the version of the Bluetooth chip. This version is compiled from the LMP version. In case of EDR the features attribute must be checked.

Returns:
Example: "Bluetooth 2.0 + EDR"

GetRevision

java.lang.String GetRevision()
                             throws Error.Failed
Returns the revision of the Bluetooth chip. This is a vendor specific value and in most cases it represents the firmware version. This might derive from the HCI revision and LMP subversion values or via extra vendor specific commands. In case the revision of a chip is not available. This method should return the LMP subversion value as a String.

Returns:
Example: "HCI 19.2"
Throws:
Error.Failed

GetManufacturer

java.lang.String GetManufacturer()
                                 throws Error.Failed
Returns the manufacturer of the Bluetooth chip. If the company id is not know the sting "Company ID %d" where %d should be replaced with the numeric value from the manufacturer field. Example: "Cambridge Silicon Radio"

Throws:
Error.Failed

GetCompany

java.lang.String GetCompany()
                            throws Error.Failed
Returns the company name from the OUI database of the Bluetooth device address. This function will need a valid and up-to-date oui.txt from the IEEE. This value will be different from the manufacturer string in the most cases. If the oui.txt file is not present or the OUI part of the BD_ADDR is not listed, it should return the string "OUI %s" where %s is the actual OUI. Example: "Apple Computer"

Throws:
Error.Failed

ListAvailableModes

java.lang.String[] ListAvailableModes()
Returns a list of available modes the adapter can be switched into.

GetMode

java.lang.String GetMode()
Returns the current mode of a adapter.

Returns:
Valid modes: "off", "connectable", "discoverable", "limited"

SetMode

void SetMode(java.lang.String mode)
             throws Error.Failed,
                    Error.NoSuchAdapter
Sets mode of the adapter. See GetMode for valid Strings for the mode parameter. Sets mode of the adapter. See GetMode for valid strings for the mode parameter. In addition to the valid strings for GetMode, this method also supports a special parameter value "on" which will change the mode to the previous non-off mode (or do nothing if the current mode isn't "off").

Parameters:
mode -
Throws:
Error.Failed
Error.NoSuchAdapter

GetDiscoverableTimeout

UInt32 GetDiscoverableTimeout()
Returns the discoverable timeout in seconds. A value of zero means that the timeout is disabled and it will stay in discoverable/limited mode forever. The default value for the discoverable timeout should be 180 seconds (3 minutes).

SetDiscoverableTimeout

void SetDiscoverableTimeout(UInt32 timeout)
                            throws Error.NotReady,
                                   Error.InvalidArguments
Sets the discoverable timeout in seconds. A value of zero disables the timeout and the adapter would be always discoverable/limited. Changing this value doesn't set the adapter into discoverable/limited mode. The SetMode method must be used.

Throws:
Error.NotReady
Error.InvalidArguments

IsConnectable

boolean IsConnectable()
Returns true if the local adapter is connectable and false if it is switched off. It is also possible to use GetMode to retrieve this information.

IsDiscoverable

boolean IsDiscoverable()
Returns true if the local adapter is discoverable/limited and false if it is only connectable or switched off. It is also possible to use GetMode to retrieve this information.

GetMajorClass

                                      Error.UnsupportedMajorClass
Returns the current major class value for this system. Currently, only "computer" is supported. For the other values, unsupported major class error is returned.

ListAvailableMinorClasses

java.lang.String[] ListAvailableMinorClasses()
                                             throws Error.InvalidArguments,
                                                    Error.UnsupportedMajorClass
Returns a list of available minor classes for the currently used major class. At the moment this should only return a list of minor classes if the major class is set to "computer". If the major class is not "computer" an error should be returned.

Throws:
Error.InvalidArguments
Error.UnsupportedMajorClass

GetMinorClass

java.lang.String GetMinorClass()
                               throws Error.InvalidArguments,
                                      Error.UnsupportedMajorClass
Returns the current minor class value for this system where the default major class is "computer". If the major class is not "computer" an error should be returned. Valid values: "uncategorized", "desktop", "server", "laptop", "handheld", "palm", "wearable" The default value is "uncategorized".

Throws:
Error.InvalidArguments
Error.UnsupportedMajorClass

GetRemoteVersion

java.lang.String GetRemoteVersion(java.lang.String address)
                                  throws Error.InvalidArguments,
                                         Error.NotAvailable
Get the version info for a remote device. This request returns always this information based on its cached data. The base for this string is the LMP version value and the features for EDR support. Not available can be received if the remote device was not contacted(connected) previously. Remote data is automatically retrieved in the first connection. Example: "Bluetooth 2.0 + EDR"

Throws:
Error.InvalidArguments
Error.NotAvailable

GetRemoteName

java.lang.String GetRemoteName(java.lang.String address)
                               throws Error.InvalidArguments,
                                      Error.NotAvailable,
                                      Error.NotReady,
                                      Error.RequestDeferred
Get the remote device's name. This request returns always a cached name. The service daemon is responsible for updating the cache. NotAvailable error is returned if the name is not in the cache. But if there is a discovery running, then this function will return RequestDeferred. In this case the service daemon will queue the request and it will try to resolve the name at the next possible opportunity. On success a RemoteNameUpdated signal will be send and if a failure happens it will be indicated by a RemoteNameFailed signal. If this is an empty String, the UI might want to display the BD_ADDR instead. Example: "00:11:22:33:44:55", "Nokia 770" throws Error.InvalidArguments Error.NotAvailable Error.NotReady Error.RequestDeferred

Throws:
Error.InvalidArguments
Error.NotAvailable
Error.NotReady
Error.RequestDeferred

GetRemoteAlias

java.lang.String GetRemoteAlias(java.lang.String address)
                                throws Error.InvalidArguments,
                                       Error.NotAvailable
Returns alias name for remote device. If this is an empty String value, the UI should show the remote name instead. An alias should supersede the remote name.

Throws:
Error.InvalidArguments
Error.NotAvailable

SetRemoteAlias

void SetRemoteAlias(java.lang.String address,
                    java.lang.String alias)
                    throws Error.Failed,
                           Error.InvalidArguments
Sets alias name for remote device. If alias name is empty, then no alias is set. On success the SetRemoteAlias method will produce a RemoteAliasChanged signal which applications can use to update their current display of the remote device name.

Throws:
Error.Failed
Error.InvalidArguments

ClearRemoteAlias

void ClearRemoteAlias(java.lang.String address)
                      throws Error.Failed,
                             Error.InvalidArguments
Resets alias name for remote device. If there is no alias set for the device this method will silently succeed, but no RemoteAliasCleared signal has to be sent in this case. On success the ClearRemoteAlias method will produce a RemoteAliasCleared signal.

Throws:
Error.Failed
Error.InvalidArguments

DisconnectRemoteDevice

void DisconnectRemoteDevice(java.lang.String address)
                            throws Error.NotReady,
                                   Error.Failed,
                                   Error.NoSuchAdapter,
                                   Error.InvalidArguments,
                                   Error.NotConnected,
                                   Error.InProgress
This method disconnects a specific remote device by terminating the low-level ACL connection. The use of this method should be restricted to administrator use. A RemoteDeviceDisconnectRequested signal will be sent and the actual disconnection will only happen 2 seconds later. This enables upper-level applications to terminate their connections gracefully before the ACL connection is terminated.

Throws:
Error.NotReady
Error.Failed
Error.NoSuchAdapter
Error.InvalidArguments
Error.NotConnected
Error.InProgress

CreateBonding

void CreateBonding(java.lang.String address)
                   throws Error.NotReady,
                          Error.Failed,
                          Error.InvalidArguments,
                          Error.AlreadyExists,
                          Error.InProgress,
                          Error.NoSuchAdapter,
                          Error.ConnectionAttemptFailed,
                          Error.AuthenticationFailed,
                          Error.AuthenticationTimeout,
                          Error.AuthenticationRejected,
                          Error.AuthenticationCanceled
This method creates a bonding with a remote device. If a link key for this adapter already exists, this procedure should fail instead of trying to create a new pairing. If no connection to the remote device exists, a low-level ACL connection must be created. This function will block and the calling application should take care of setting are higher timeout. This might be needed in case of a page timeout from the low-level HCI commands. In case of success it will send a BondingCreated signal.

Throws:
Error.NotReady
Error.Failed
Error.InvalidArguments
Error.AlreadyExists
Error.InProgress
Error.NoSuchAdapter
Error.ConnectionAttemptFailed
Error.AuthenticationFailed
Error.AuthenticationTimeout
Error.AuthenticationRejected
Error.AuthenticationCanceled

CancelBondingProcess

void CancelBondingProcess(java.lang.String address)
                          throws Error.NotReady,
                                 Error.Failed,
                                 Error.InvalidArguments,
                                 Error.NotInProgress,
                                 Error.NotAuthorized
This method will cancel the CreateBonding process. The CreateBonding method will return AuthenticationCanceled to signal that an attempt to create a bonding has been canceled.

Throws:
Error.NotReady
Error.Failed
Error.InvalidArguments
Error.NotInProgress
Error.NotAuthorized

RemoveBonding

void RemoveBonding(java.lang.String address)
                   throws Error.NotReady,
                          Error.Failed,
                          Error.InvalidArguments,
                          Error.NoSuchAdapter,
                          Error.DoesNotExist
This method removes the bonding with a remote device. For security reasons this includes removing the actual link key and also disconnecting any open connections for the remote device. If the link key was stored on the Bluetooth chip, it must be removed from there, too. After deleting the link key this method will send a BondingRemoved signal.

Throws:
Error.NotReady
Error.Failed
Error.InvalidArguments
Error.NoSuchAdapter
Error.DoesNotExist

                   throws Error.InvalidArguments
Returns true if the remote device is bonded and false if no link key is available.

Throws:
Error.InvalidArguments

DiscoverDevices

void DiscoverDevices()
                     throws Error.NotReady,
                            Error.Failed,
                            Error.InProgress,
                            Error.NoSuchAdapter
This method starts the device discovery procedure. This includes an inquiry procedure and remote device name resolving.

On start up this process will generate a DiscoveryStarted signal and then return RemoteDeviceFound and also RemoteNameUpdated signals. If the procedure has been finished an DiscoveryCompleted signal will be sent.

Throws:
Error.NotReady
Error.Failed
Error.InProgress
Error.NoSuchAdapter

DiscoverDevicesWithoutNameResolving

void DiscoverDevicesWithoutNameResolving()
                                         throws Error.NotReady,
                                                Error.Failed,
                                                Error.InProgress,
                                                Error.NoSuchAdapter
This method starts the device discovery procedure. This includes an inquiry and an optional remote device name resolving. The remote names can be retrieved with GetRemoteName and in the case a name doesn't exist it will be queued for later resolving and GetRemoteName will return an error.

While this procedure is running every found device will be returned with RemoteDeviceFound. While DiscoverDevices() automatically resolves unknown devices names and sends RemoteNameUpdated in this case it will only happen if GetRemoteName has been called and no previously stored name is available.

Throws:
Error.NotReady
Error.Failed
Error.InProgress
Error.NoSuchAdapter

CancelDiscovery

void CancelDiscovery()
                     throws Error.NotReady,
                            Error.Failed,
                            Error.NotAuthorized,
                            Error.NoSuchAdapter
This method will cancel any previous DiscoverDevices or DiscoverDevicesWithoutNameResolving actions.

Throws:
Error.NotReady
Error.Failed
Error.NotAuthorized
Error.NoSuchAdapter

                                   Error.Failed,
                                   Error.InProgress,
                                   Error.NoSuchAdapter

Throws:
Error.NotReady
Error.Failed
Error.InProgress
Error.NoSuchAdapter

StopPeriodicDiscovery

void StopPeriodicDiscovery()
                           throws Error.NotReady,
                                  Error.Failed,
                                  Error.NotAuthorized,
                                  Error.NoSuchAdapter
This method stops a periodic discovery. If the adapter is not in the periodic inquiry mode an error(not authorized) is returned. Everyone can request exit from this mode, it is not restricted to start requestor.

Throws:
Error.NotReady
Error.Failed
Error.NotAuthorized
Error.NoSuchAdapter

IsPeriodicDiscovery

boolean IsPeriodicDiscovery()
Returns true if the periodic inquiry is active and false if it is switched off.

                                               throws Error.InProgress,
                                                      Error.Failed
This method will request the SDP database of a remote device for all supported services. The identifiers are returned in UUID 128 String format.

Parameters:
address -
Returns:
Throws:
Error.InProgress
Error.Failed

FinishRemoteServiceTransaction

void FinishRemoteServiceTransaction(java.lang.String address)
This method will finish all SDP transaction for that given address. In general this call is not needed, but in cases of resources restricted devices it is useful to call this to finish the SDP transaction before proceeded with profile specific connections.

Since:
BlueZ 3.10

ListRemoteDevices

java.lang.String[] ListRemoteDevices()
List addresses of all known remote devices (bonded, trusted and used).

Since:
BlueZ 3.8

ListRecentRemoteDevices

java.lang.String[] ListRecentRemoteDevices(java.lang.String date)
List addresses of all bonded, trusted, seen or used remote devices since date. Bonded and trusted devices are always included(the date informed is not applied). date format is "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS GMT"

Parameters:
date -
Returns:
Since:
BlueZ 3.8
